name: Achari Salad
history: Achari Salad incorporates the flavors of Indian pickles (Achar) into a salad. It's a fusion dish that combines the tangy, spicy taste of traditional Indian pickles with fresh vegetables, creating a unique and flavorful salad experience.
description: Achari Salad is a vibrant and tangy salad made with a mix of fresh vegetables and a dressing inspired by Indian pickle spices. It typically includes ingredients like onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and a blend of Achari spices for an intense flavor.

instructions.title: Prepare the Vegetables
instructions.description: Dice the cucumbers, tomatoes, and red bell pepper. Finely chop the onions and green chilies. Grate the carrots and slice the radishes.

instructions.title: Make the Achari Dressing
instructions.description: In a small bowl, mix lemon juice, Achari masala, salt, chaat masala (if using), and olive oil to make the dressing.

instructions.title: Combine Salad and Dressing
instructions.description: In a large mixing bowl, combine all the chopped vegetables. Pour the Achari dressing over the vegetables and toss well to coat.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander and mint leaves. Serve the Achari Salad fresh as a side dish or a healthy snack.

tips: For a more intense flavor, allow the salad to marinate in the dressing for a few minutes before serving.
Adjust the amount of Achari masala and green chilies according to your spice preference.
variations: Add boiled chickpeas or paneer for extra protein.
Experiment with different vegetables like beetroot or avocado.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be refrigerated for a few hours.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a colorful bowl to enhance the visual appeal of the salad.
Garnish with a lemon wedge or sprinkle with sesame seeds for added texture.
